alert.note: Alert for Nash; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Warren, northeastern Nash, northwestern Edgecombe and Halifax Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Littleton to 10 miles west of Halifax to 13 miles northeast of Dortches. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rocky Mount, Roanoke Rapids, Halifax, Scotland Neck, Dortches, Red Oak, Enfield, Weldon, Whitakers and Glenview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
